page.title: 18MUNDON
page.content: Mundon is situated between{Limbourne {Creek and Lawling Creek, }which might account for its smuggling reputation. The parish of Mundon once supplied the{oaks}for the building of the warships ,which the{ancient Borough of {Maldon}had to provide for the{Royal {cause}under the terms of the{Royal {Charter of 1171. Mundon Hall once the seat of the Lord of the Manor in the 17th century, still shows part of the ancient moat defence. Stud Farm once had{Tolstoy}as a guest ,it is suggested he wrote part of{War and Peace},during his stay.
